title: Toll concessions if you're a driver with a disability

body.content:
You may not have to pay the full fare at some river crossings, bridges and tunnels if you're disabled. In most cases, you have to apply in advance to get a concession.

%Always check for the latest toll rates before you travel.%

Find out more about concessions you can get at:

+ [Cleddau Bridge (A477 Pembroke Dock)](http://www.pembrokeshire.gov.uk/content.asp?nav=838,2227&parent_directory_id=646&id=28788&language=)
+ [Clifton Suspension Bridge (B3129 Bristol)](http://www.cliftonbridge.org.uk/commute/disabled-concession)
+ [Dartford - Thurrock River Crossing (River Thames - A282/M25 Junction 1a)](https://www.gov.uk/dartford-crossing-fees-exemptions-penalties)
+ [Humber Bridge (near Hull)](http://www.humberbridge.co.uk/toll_information/toll_concessions.php)
+ [Itchen Bridge (A3025 Woolston-Southampton)](http://www.southampton.gov.uk/roads-parking/roads/default.aspx)
+ [M6 Motorway (Birmingham Toll)](http://www.m6toll.co.uk/pricing/exemptions/)
+ [Mersey Tunnel (Liverpool-Wirral)](http://www.merseytunnels.co.uk/nossl/html/concessionary.php)
+ [Severn Bridge (M48 England – Wales) and Second Severn Crossing (M4 England - Wales)](https://www.severnbridge.co.uk/Home.aspx?.Parent=using-the-tolls2&FileName=using-the-tolls2)
+ [Tamar Bridge (A38 Plymouth-Liskeard) and Torpoint Ferry (A374 Plymouth-Torpoint)](http://www.tamarcrossings.org.uk/index.aspx?articleid=49626)
+ [Tyne Tunnel (near Newcastle)](https://www.tt2.co.uk/s/exempt-form.html)
+ [Whitchurch Bridge (B471 Pangbourne-Whitchurch)](http://www.whitchurchbridge.com/rates.html)
